description.raw:
This adds a robot_state_publisher to the multisense camera.
Note: this will work even better once we get the latest `ihmc_valkyrie_ros` that doesn't publish them https://github.com/ihmcrobotics/ihmc_valkyrie_ros/commit/1d6ac01bca4195ac37c2f3a913c5e7df09a2580c

I didnt modify the logic of relaying the topics published by the multisense.
I could use some input on the camera topics we expose to users. My understanding is that we are publishing the same colored pointcloud on 2 different topics [here](#!/osrf/srcsim/src/0cf9854d17153514a51041e569f0a66b6e58b52c/launch/unique_task3.launch?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#unique_task3.launch-59:73). To do so we create 2 ROS nodes that listen to a colored pointcloud and publish it on 2 topics: `/multisense/image_points2` and `/multisense/image_points2_color`

Looking at the [multisense doc](http://docs.carnegierobotics.com/SL/api.html#api) it looks like `/multisense/image_points2` is meant to be a grayscale pointcloud and `/multisense/image_points2_color` a colored one. 

My suggestion: don't publish anything on `/multisense/image_points2` and publish the colored pointcloud directly on `/multisense/image_points2_color`. We can use the ROS remapping functionality to do so, this would avoid creating these 2 relay nodes and allow the message to be sent only once rather than 4 times.

Thoughts?
description.html:
This adds a robot_state_publisher to the multisense camera. Note: this will work even better once we get the latest ihmc_valkyrie_ros that doesn't publish them https://github.com/ihmcrobotics/ihmc_valkyrie_ros/commit/1d6ac01bca4195ac37c2f3a913c5e7df09a2580c

I didnt modify the logic of relaying the topics published by the multisense. I could use some input on the camera topics we expose to users. My understanding is that we are publishing the same colored pointcloud on 2 different topics here. To do so we create 2 ROS nodes that listen to a colored pointcloud and publish it on 2 topics: /multisense/image_points2 and /multisense/image_points2_color

Looking at the multisense doc it looks like /multisense/image_points2 is meant to be a grayscale pointcloud and /multisense/image_points2_color a colored one.

My suggestion: don't publish anything on /multisense/image_points2 and publish the colored pointcloud directly on /multisense/image_points2_color. We can use the ROS remapping functionality to do so, this would avoid creating these 2 relay nodes and allow the message to be sent only once rather than 4 times.

Thoughts?

title: Publish multisense transforms
